attributes.action: To recognise Holodomor, the Ukrainian famine of 1932-33, as an act of genocide.
attributes.background: The Holodomor, was engineered by the Soviet government. Seven and a half million people died of starvation over a period of one year. Twenty Five countries have currently recognised this as an act of genocide, as defined by the 1948 UN Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of Genocide.
